author: dcspark
title: Open-ended Research
description: Quels flux de recherche peuvent être lancés ou accélérés pour que Cardano reste compétitif ?

f6_assessments.q0: L'ouverture de nouveaux courants de recherche sur des sujets importants, tels que l'évolutivité, l'interopérabilité, les intégrations, les protocoles de réseau, les nouveaux paradigmes de conception, etc., ouvrira la voie à l'innovation, la croissance, l'accélération et l'évolution de l'écosystème Cardano. Le fait d'avoir un Challenge dédié en vaut vraiment la peine. Actuellement, IOG est à la pointe de la recherche sur Cardano. L'élargissement du champ de recherche et des ressources par le biais de propositions de Catalyst peut renforcer l'écosystème et le développement de dapps. La communauté Cardano devrait avoir la possibilité d'explorer et de faire de la recherche de manière cohérente grâce au financement de Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: Les capacités de la communauté à relever un défi de recherche ouvert ne doivent pas être sous-estimées, en particulier aux premiers stades de l'écosystème Cardano. Le développement et l'intégration de Dapps dans un environnement novateur tel que la blockchain Cardano, avec ses caractéristiques uniques, exigent un niveau d'engagement élevé. Je crois fermement que la communauté Cardano a la capacité de le faire. Nous sommes entre de bonnes mains avec dcSpark dans l'équipe du défi, qui est plus que capable d'encourager et d'inspirer un tel effort.
f6_assessments.q2: S'agissant d'un défi de recherche ouvert, on pourrait dire que les critères de réussite et les mesures suggérées ne sont pas si pertinents. La proposition de défi ne décrit pas clairement les critères de réussite, les mesures clés ou le modèle de recherche qui devrait être suivi, par exemple la méthode formelle d'examen par les pairs. Je pense que dans ce cas, la proposition devrait être plus claire et plus informative pour les votants sur les normes de recherche à suivre (comme IOG a défini la norme de recherche pour Cardano sur la méthodologie d'examen par les pairs). Néanmoins, l'équipe du défi aura d'autres occasions de clarifier et de fournir des informations supplémentaires aux proposants une fois que cette proposition de défi aura été approuvée par les électeurs.

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

The objective of incentivizing independent research in the community supports the strategic goal of Fund 8 to grow the number of contributors.

Having said that and given the limited funding of Catalyst, the proposal can benefit from a clearer specification of matching projects to ensure high ROI in comparison to alternative challenges:
1) what should be the maximum duration of research?
2) what should be the sizes of use cases impacted of research?

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for supporting only one out three objectives of Fund8.
- 1 point for the lack of a clearer vision how to approach research to guarantee the ROI for the community.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Catalyst community is well positioned to fund independent research and incentivize contributions from researchers. Moreover, the scientific research is a long-proven driver of economic progress, and Cardano has a preference for science-driven progress.

However, to ensure the short-term impact (why this fund and not next?), the proposal could be specific with regards to the key targeted use cases to judge about the necessary skills and resources and the ROI of the initiatives.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of targeted use cases.
- 1 point for the lack of discusion why the requested funds are sufficient to make noticeable progress towards the key use cases.
- 1 point for the lack of examples of successful non-IO-driven research to prove the feasibility.
My rating is 2.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposed metrics (the amount of research content, implementation traction, etc.) are valid ways to measure some progress.

However, out of my experience as a product manager in a science-heavy field, it is important to measure not only the activity but also the impact of the research.

For example, some of the following metrics could be considered to make the proposal stronger:
1) the % of papers that have been implemented in at least one project.
2) the % of users that were onboarded as a direct consequence of problems solved by this initiative.
3) the % of transaction volume that was created as a direct consequence of the problems solved by this initiative.
4) the community satisfaction and the competitiveness of the research vs competitors (% of use cases where cardano is at the State-of-the-Art level).

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluting the impact on the community.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluting the community satisfaction and competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: I agree that non-IOG decentralized research is critical to further achieve the mission of full decentralization.
f6_assessments.q1: I think this is a yes and no sort of answer. I am not sure exactly how it will get done or be addressed, but I believe it is possible and feasible if IOG allow it.
f6_assessments.q2: Not super clear on what a good outcome would be vs a bad outcome.  If it's only measured by saying "Number of content" and "Amount of Research" it is unclear what your specific goals are. If you end up having 2 content or research articles adopted, did you satisfy your goal? If you have 10? 20? 100? I believe the success criteria should be more specific. For example, it should be if in the end cardano has an open-sourced/decentralized research & development project then that is success. Less about the number of content and research and more about the actual end goal of Open-ended Research being adopted and added to road map. It seems impossible to measure success if you don't specify at what point you have succeeded. I believe this would be a never ending research project to improve cardano, so I don't think the amount of content is important because it should be unlimited amount of content/research, the most important part is that open-ended research is widely adopted and there is an entire project or catalyst section dedicated to open-ended research, that is success to me.

f6_assessments.q0: Decentralization is the master key for any blockchain. Various streams of thought are very much needed to achieve it.
f6_assessments.q1: There are pleanty of capable people in the community to address the challenges faced by a decentralized ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: The successes and metrics are easly verifiable through the documents and future CIPs which will eventually be created through funding.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge aligns with the mission of getting people to make contributions to the Cardano ecosystem and to accelerate the growth of the application ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: There are plenty of examples of the Catalyst community funding research work scattered in different challenges in past funds which is a strong indication of capacity to address the challenge. Consolidating the funding into one research challenge is an good means of scoping the level of demand. To improve the challenge provide justification for the chosen budget size.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and metrics are ok but I would like to see an explicit statement that all funded research should be open source or publicly available. To improve challenge: better articulate how the metrics can measure progress towards the success criteria.

f6_assessments.q0: I certainly think this kind of research is critical to advance  the Cardano mission. As the network develops tracking these metrics will be important as they will be used to implement improvements with regards to the network being optimized.
f6_assessments.q1: I'm not sure if the catalyst community is going to have success addressing this concern or rather need to gather some of this information without incurring centralization concerns.
f6_assessments.q2: If the basis of success is solely rated by being able to discuss this gathered information on a technical level without finding ways for it to have direct positive impact on the overall community and serve everyone in a way they can identify. Having an entity solely focused on this information might be of concern with regards to not being decentralized.

importance: La blockchain est un domaine qui évolue rapidement. La recherche IOG a permis à Cardano de rester compétitif, mais il doit être plus facile pour la recherche non-IOG d'avoir lieu.
success: Documents écrits (CIP, documents de recherche, articles techniques) qui suscitent un débat au sein de la communauté Cardano et sont ajoutés à la feuille de route.
